review: While at first it was pretty buggy such as crashing after about ten minutes of casting, with the passing of a few updates the experience became more stable. A helpful tip to casting is to connect to the Chromecast before selecting any video, because sometimes the Chromecast icon doesn't show up while a video is playing. The initial setup was fast and easy taking a maximum of ten minutes. Overall, a useful product for people who watch shows on a regular basis and want an inexpensive solution for watching it on the TV.
author: Ben

review: I have just ordered my second Chromecast for my home. The first one was placed on my bedroom TV and has been great. It has support for my Netflix and Hulu accounts and lets me play YouTube videos on my TV. It is easy to set up, and only takes a few minutes. Once set up, each additional phone or tablet only requires about a minute to connect.It would be better if it supported all video apps or allowed mirroring of the tablet screen. However, these are minor drawbacks compared to the overall utility. Also, several apps have gotten updates since I bought my first one and now allow me to stream video.Good:Connects easily to multiple devicesReplaces my much more expensive cableSupports access to my most used video applicationsReplaces my remote control for most TV functionsBad:It is not quite instantaneous and sometimes requires me to restart Apps or my phoneIt does not have support for all video apps (this can presumably be corrected by third party Apps, but they cost extra)
author: Leslie Dane Hanna

review: This is the easiest way to use Youtube or Netflix on your television. I got this so that I could stream Netflix on an older, non-smart TV and I find that the picture quality and ease of use is so great, that I'm considering getting another for my smart tv... the smart TV interface isn't nearly as appealing as the Chromecast. Best $35 I've spent in a long time.
